maqras.text: The Beneficent
He taught the Quran
He created man
He taught him to express (by action, speech, writing etc)
The sun and the moon (function) according to a calculation
And the herbs and the trees bow down (to Him)
And the sky, He has raised it, and He has set the balance
(by ordering) that: Do not exceed (the limits) in the balance
and establish the balance in a just manner and do not reduce the balance
And the earth He has layed down for the cattle (living beings)
Therein are fruits and palm trees (with) sheathed (dates)
and grains with husk and the scented herb
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
He created man from mud, like (that used in) pottery
And He created the jinn from (the heat wave) let free from fire
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Lord of the two places/times of sun rise and Lord of the two places/times of sun set (at the summer and winter solstice)
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
He let free the two seas (which) meet
(but) between them is a barrier which they do not pass
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
There come out from both of them pearls and corals
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
And His are the ships, with elevated sails, (sailing) in the sea, like mountains
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
All who are on it will perish
and there will remain the Face (Person) of your Lord, Possessor of glory and honour
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Whoever is in the skies and the earth asks from Him, everyday (each moment) He is in a state (of intending something or implementing some affair)
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
We will free (Ourselves) for you, O you two weighty (things)
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
O assembly of jinn and mankind! if you are able to pass through the boundaries (or spheres) of the skies and the earth, then pass through, you will not pass through except with authority
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Flames of fire (without smoke) and hot smoke (without flames) will be sent on you both, then you will not be able to defend
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
So when the sky splits and becomes red like red hide
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
So on that day neither man nor jinn will be questioned about his sin
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
The criminals will be recognised by their marks, so they will be caught by the forelocks and feet
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
This is hell which the criminals denied
they will go round between it and between hot boiling water
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
And for him who feared to stand before his Lord are two gardens
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Having in them various kinds
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them are flowing springs
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them every (kind) of fruit will be in two pairs
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Reclining on spreadings (like bed sheets, carpets etc.) the inner linings of which will be of silk brocade, and the fruits of the two gardens will be near
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them will be females who restrain their gaze, whom neither man nor jinn touched before them
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
As if they were rubies and corals
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Is the reward of good (something) other than good
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
And besides these two, are two more gardens
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Both, dark green in colour
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them are two springs gushing forth
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them are fruits and date palms and pomegranates
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
In both of them are good and beautiful ones
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Fair ones, confined in pavilions
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Whom neither man nor jinn touched before them
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets
So which of the bounties of your Lord will you both deny
Blessed is the name of your Lord, Possessor of glory and honour
